data.title: "Check for Update" on Windows appears broken
data.body:
I'm running 0.175 and noticed when I looked at the Atom repo on Github that there is a new release 0.176. I went to the Help menu and clicked on "Check for Update" and it tells me that 0.175 is the latest version. Here is a screenshot:

![atom-auto-update-broken](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/190154/5909454/d550fa84-a57e-11e4-9482-77535a2f03ed.PNG)

data.title: Better error when git is required during package installation
data.body: People bump into this quite a bit. See atom/apm#236 and #5193 and #5206

data.title: :arrow_up: bump tree view for new sort option
atom:// url package installation
data.body:
Elaborating on #2037:

To allow some interesting integrations with atom.io, we should allow users to initiate package installation from the `atom://` url handler. There are a number of questions to answer:
- [ ] What work in atom core & atom-shell is required to support this on all 3 platforms?
  - Windows registry doc: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa767914(v=vs.85).aspx
  - The current top answer to this is relevant, showing how to use gconf on a system with gnome: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1947209/registering-a-url-protocol-handler-in-a-multiple-platforms
- [ ] What are the user concerns around security and predictability and how can we address them?
  - Users should always know what is being installed and have to explicitly confirm installations initiated outside the editor
- [ ] What's a general-purpose UI look like for this, given the editor can be in any state when installation is initiated?
  - Probably a modal in the active window?

data.title: Selecting Files in Tree View don't open until switching windows.
data.body:
Hi,

The issue I am seeing is when I select a file in the tree view, nothing happens. I can click it multiple times, click other files, continue editing, etc. Once I switch to any other window, and return to atom, anything I've clicked in the tree view will then open. Including the same files multiple times. I now have just grown a habit of clicking the file in the tree view, and then clicking another window and back into atom.

This is happening frequently, but not always for myself and some people I know. From what I can tell, this only happens to Windows Users, and did not happen prior to Windows auto Updates, though I can't give a specific version # I started seeing it.

data.title: Build error : cannot find module 'walkdir' whole buildings.
data.body:
Hello , i haven't update Atom.io for long, today i did git pull to  updated from 143 to latest master.
When i tried to ./script/build i get this error.

Loading "index.js" tasks...ERROR

> > Error: Cannot find module 'walkdir'

Then continue to download-atom-shell task but , it stops after , nothing is printed out.

data.title: Install to computer instead of user profile
data.body: We would like a package that installs to the computer instead of into the users profile.   Security policies prevent execution of programs installed to the profile and this will make the software available to all users of the computer.

data.title: Editor styles break on theme update
data.body:
When performing a theme update in 0.175 of Atom for Windows, the tab interface shrunk down and wasn't clickable during the update.

![atomimage](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1765755/5899816/cc981ed4-a526-11e4-9845-32490fee42cd.PNG)

Then after the update the tabs returned to normal.

![atomimage2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1765755/5899820/e34266a8-a526-11e4-959c-8d84b2148ad0.PNG)

It doesn't happen when on the install page of Settings. I also don't currently have another package to update at the moment to test if this is specifically seen with the theme i am using or if it is an Atom issue.

Is this normal behavior during updates though? I Also noticed that the package buttons to update, uninstall, or settings also expand during the update.

data.title: ctrl-q quits atom without prompting to save modified files
data.body: With such a keybinding, it is far too easy to lose work, i.e. when hitting it accidentally, or when slipping from a similar keybinding. This happenned to me few times now when I wanted to reflow selection (default keybinding ctrl-alt-q) but instead, I ended up with atom closed and work lost.

data.title: Delay onDidChange for string types.
data.body: I have a situation where I need to ensure  the user inputs a string in a specific format. I thought it would be nice to do some regex on the config string and format it accordingly. Furthermore it would feel a lot cleaner if I could do this using the onDidChange method. I gave it a shot but Atom froze up and when it didn't the change was instant and trying something was impossible. I would like to request a feature that delays the process until the settings window is closed to execute the callback.

data.title: atom binary: Open all folders in one window
data.body:
E.g. running:

``` shell
$ atom /usr/local/etc/supervisor/conf.d/ /usr/local/etc/nginx/conf.d
```

Should open just one window with both these folders in one window, like sublime. At least I would love to see that.

(I also miss being able to use `Cmd-Shift-F` for searching the opened folder, even when it's not an actual project. Is there another way?)

data.title: | (pipe) is not possible on a danish keyboard on windows
data.body:
If I want to write | (pipe), I press AltGr + ´ or in keycodes `17`+`18`+`192`. Possible you could omit `17`.
What happens is that the code block collapse. Since I'm writing javascript, I need to write | on a daily basis.
I couldn't find anything about AltGr on https://atom.io/docs/latest/customizing-atom#customizing-key-bindings

data.title: Partial selection is left behind
Provide a way to do syntax specific LanguageModes (extend LanguageMode)
data.body:
Hi,

Currently there is no public way to extend LanguageMode. This causes issues with languages that wont for example fit to the way atom currently handles indentation (only increase and decrease pattern). Only way I was able to get these kind of languages to properly indent was to "extend" LanguageMode by monkey patching it at run time. Monkey patching atom internals is something I would not like to do.

Code from my package (react)

``` coffee
patchEditorLangModeSuggestedIndentForBufferRow: (editor) ->
    self = this
    fn = editor.languageMode.suggestedIndentForBufferRow
    editor.languageMode.suggestedIndentForBufferRow = (bufferRow, options) ->
      indent = fn.call(editor.languageMode, bufferRow, options)
      return indent unless editor.getGrammar().scopeName == "source.js.jsx" and bufferRow > 1

      scopeDescriptor = @editor.scopeDescriptorForBufferPosition([bufferRow, 0])
      decreaseNextLineIndentRegex = @getRegexForProperty(scopeDescriptor, 'react.decreaseIndentForNextLinePattern')
      increaseIndentRegex = @increaseIndentRegexForScopeDescriptor(scopeDescriptor)
      tagStartRegex = @getRegexForProperty(scopeDescriptor, 'react.jsxTagStartPattern')
      complexAttributeRegex = @getRegexForProperty(scopeDescriptor, 'react.jsxComplexAttributePattern')

      precedingRow = @buffer.previousNonBlankRow(bufferRow)

      return indent if precedingRow < 0

      if @editor.isBufferRowCommented(bufferRow) and @editor.isBufferRowCommented(precedingRow)
        return @editor.indentationForBufferRow(precedingRow)

      precedingLine = @buffer.lineForRow(precedingRow)

      return indent if not precedingLine?

      indent += 1 if tagStartRegex.testSync(precedingLine) and complexAttributeRegex.testSync(precedingLine) and not @editor.isBufferRowCommented(precedingRow)
      indent -= 1 if precedingLine and decreaseNextLineIndentRegex.testSync(precedingLine) and not @editor.isBufferRowCommented(precedingRow)

      return Math.max(indent, 0)
```

data.title: Expose atoms version of prebuild atom-oniguruma
data.body:
Hi,

I'm currently maintaining a grammar extension (react) for atom. I was first using atom-oniguruma for regular expressions, but ended up dropping it as a dependency for the package as building it caused problems for windows users. As a workaround I had to leverage how LanguageMode creates OnigRegExp instances for patterns trough the config apis https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/language-mode.coffee#L319. This is really hackish and causes the config keys and values to appear in the package settings page.

``` javascript
// when plugin is activated
atom.config.set("react.decreaseIndentForNextLinePattern", decreaseIndentForNextLinePattern)

// And then
decreaseNextLineIndentRegex = languageMode.getRegexForProperty(scopeDescriptor, 'react.decreaseIndentForNextLinePattern')
```

Would be nice if native atom utility packages could be exposed trough the atom global variable (atom.utils etc.) or if you have other suggestions on how to use atom-oniguruma without causing problems for windows users.

Thanks!

data.title: [Docs] Rename LESS to Less
data.body: [Less is now written without caps lock](http://lesscss.org/), so I went through and updated the docs to reflect that.

data.title: Specific pane manipulation prevents panes from being deleted.
data.body:
Atom 0.175.0
Mac OSX 10.10.1

When I split Panes in a window-like fashion.... Image 1

```
panes = atom.workspace.getPanes()
panes[0].splitDown()
panes[0].splitRight()
panes = atom.workspace.getPanes()
panes[2].splitRight()
```

Then open a untitled document in the 4th window.... Image 2

Then add and remove Panes until it changes to a horizontal layout.... Image 3

```
for pane in atom.workspace.getPanes()
  pane.destroy() if pane.getItems().length is 0
```

Then I can no longer remove Panes.... Image 4

Will continue to investigate incase this is a fault on my behalf.

---

For further details on pane manipulation: https://github.com/chemoish/atom-pane-layout

data.title: package upgrade failure stops all following upgrades

I have 11 packages waiting to be upgraded.  My first one is throwing an exception and the whole process dies.  This means until I solve the problem with the first one all others will have to wait.

I will uninstall the offending package for now but this should be fixed.

data.title: Feature Request: Make package updates automatically happen in the background
data.body:
Since I don't need to visit the settings page often, I often find my packages out of date. Automatic package updates in the background will ensure that.

I would recommend this by default, but there should at the very least be a setting to opt-in.
